faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Get answers to common questions about attic insulation

questions.q: How long does attic insulation installation take?
questions.a: Most residential installations are completed in 4-8 hours, depending on the size of your home. We work efficiently to minimize disruption to your daily routine.

questions.q: What R-value insulation do I need in Ottawa?
questions.a: For Ottawa's climate, we recommend R-60 to R-70 for optimal energy efficiency. Our assessment will determine the exact R-value needed for your specific home and current insulation levels.

questions.q: Will insulation installation create a mess in my home?
questions.a: No. We use protective coverings throughout your home and employ dust-controlled installation methods. Our team performs complete cleanup, leaving your home cleaner than we found it.

questions.q: What rebates are available for insulation upgrades?
questions.a: Ontario residents can receive up to $5,000 in combined rebates from federal, provincial, and utility programs. We handle all paperwork and ensure you receive maximum available rebates.

questions.q: How much will I save on energy bills?
questions.a: Most customers see up to 40% reduction in heating and cooling costs. The exact savings depend on your home's current insulation, size, and energy usage patterns.

questions.q: Do you offer warranties on your work?
questions.a: Yes. Materials come with a limited lifetime warranty from the manufacturer, and I personally provide a warranty on the quality of my installation work.

questions.q: Can you insulate other areas besides the attic?
questions.a: Absolutely. We also insulate basements, crawl spaces, walls, and rim joists. Our assessment will identify all areas where improved insulation can benefit your home.

questions.q: Is blown-in insulation better than batt insulation?
questions.a: For attics, blown-in insulation is superior as it fills gaps and irregular spaces completely, providing better thermal performance and air sealing compared to traditional batts.
